title: Trofo
author: Trofo
content: I would like to return all spare bitcoin from transaction to the sending address. It is escrow wallet with multisig and I would like the funds to always stay on same address after making payments.What is the proper way of doing this? Is there some option to tweak or maybe i just add another receiver on the end of transaction withMyoriginaladdress, !

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Trofo on June 10, 2022, 12:06:19 PMWhat is the proper way of doing this? Is there some option to tweak or maybe i just add another receiver on the end of transaction withMyoriginaladdress, !When I want to get the change in a spending address instead of change address, I also use successfully <address>,! I find it as good option as any.Another direction should be to uncheck in preferences the use of change addresses; I've never used this option, but it looks designed for your use case.PS. If you have Advanced Preview enabled, you can take a look onto the transaction before broadcasting; it may help, to be sure.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: Trofo on June 10, 2022, 12:06:19 PMMyoriginaladdress, !Yup, that's all it takes.  On the confirmation screen you'll see where the change is going, and if it's an Electrum selected change address it'll be highlighted in yellow, and if it's a standard receiving address from the same wallet it'll be highlighted in green.  If you've set up the payment correctly you'll see your original (the sending) address as highlighted in green, indicating that the change will be sent there.
